The SUV market continues to expand with the introduction of electric and hybrid models, catering to sustainability demands. Rising urbanization and increasing disposable income drive SUV sales globally. Manufacturers innovate with autonomous features and connectivity solutions to enhance user experience and market competitiveness. MARKET DYNAMICS: Manufacturers are integrating advanced technology into SUVs, enhancing safety, connectivity, and performance. The demand for electric and hybrid SUVs continues to grow as consumers seek fuel-efficient and environmentally friendly options. Automakers focus on lightweight materials and aerodynamic designs to improve fuel economy without compromising durability. Luxury SUV models with premium interiors, smart infotainment systems, and autonomous driving features attract a rising number of buyers. Upcoming trends indicate a stronger push toward sustainability, with brands investing in hydrogen-powered and fully electric SUVs. The expansion of online vehicle sales platforms provides consumers with a seamless purchasing experience, increasing digital engagement. Emerging markets are witnessing a surge in SUV demand, driven by improved road infrastructure and rising disposable income. Automakers are also developing compact and urban-friendly SUV models to cater to city dwellers looking for versatile and fuel-efficient vehicles. Rising urbanization and changing lifestyles have led many families to seek vehicles that offer both comfort and functionality. Advancements in technology, such as improved fuel efficiency and enhanced safety features, also attract buyers looking for reliable options. Additionally, the growing popularity of outdoor activities fuels demand for SUVs that can handle diverse terrains and conditions. With the latest updates and comfortable features, the Mahindra XUV 3XO is on the list of must-buy compact SUVs in India. Here, we will take a closer look at the Mahindra XUV 3XO features explained and help you choose the ideal car. Influencing Exterior Look The Mahindra XUV 3XO has a specific design to turn heads with its athletic stance. It commands respect and exudes the confidence of a true SUV. The all-new Mahindra XUV 3XO has an ample ground clearance of 201 mm, making it easy for you to drive on rocky terrains. In addition, the XUV 3XO comes with a command seating position to offer an exhilarating driving experience. The Mahindra XUV 3XO has LED DRLs and headlamps that will lead the road to envy you whenever you turn them on. Furthermore, the infinity tail lamps add an X factor to your style quotient. The car also features 17-inch diamond-cut alloy wheels for that sporty look. Check out: Mahindra XUV 3XO Dimensions 2. Comforting Interior When you drive the Mahindra XUV 3XO, it elevates your every journey. Stepping inside the XUV 3XOs cabin will let you discover a sanctuary of sophistication and comfort. It is one of the key parts of the Mahindra XUV 3XO features explained, as it has a meticulous design for the finest SUV lovers. The Mahindra XUV 3XO features a Skyroof and soft-touch leatherette on the door trims and dashboard. Furthermore, the car has premium leatherette seats, a cooled glovebox with illumination, and a passive keyless entry. It also features a front armrest with storage and a console with a cup holder for a comfortable drive. Check out: Mahindra XUV 3XO Interior 3. Smart Connectivity Another key Mahindra XUV 3XO configuration is its smart connectivity and technology. The car comes with a Harman Kardon 7-speaker audio system to make your drive enjoyable. In addition, the sound system lets you experience sonic expanse, and the bass enhancer technology uplifts your mood while driving in crowded areas. The Mahindra XUV 3XO features a high-definition touchscreen system for infotainment and navigation and has built-in Amazon Alexa for entertainment. The XUV 3XO secured this accolade for both adult and child occupant protection, underlining Mahindras focus on providing world-class safety features in its vehicles. This latest recognition comes on the heels of Bharat NCAP's recent safety assessments of other prominent SUVs, including Tata models and the Citroen Basalt, as well as Mahindras own Thar Roxx and XUV 400 EV, both of which also earned 5-star ratings. The XUV 3XO demonstrated strong safety performance in multiple areas of testing. It achieved a remarkable total score of 29.36 out of 32 for adult occupant protection. In the frontal offset deformable barrier test, the SUV exhibited excellent protection for the co-driver, with good ratings across all body regions. However, the driver's chest, legs, and feet received ratings of adequate to marginal due to the impact forces recorded during the collision. Despite these minor deductions, protection to the driver's head, hip, and thigh was rated as good, reinforcing the XUV 3XOs overall structural integrity and crashworthiness. The XUV 3XO excelled in the side barrier and pole impact tests, securing a full 16 out of 16 points . The ISOFIX and top tether anchorages were standard in 2 outboard rear seats. In the frontal offset deformable test, the SUV offered good protection to the drivers and passengers head, neck, and abdomen. The drivers chest and right leg showed adequate protection while the left leg showed marginal protection. The passengers chest and legs were well protected. In the side movable deformable barrier test and side pole impact test, the SUV offered good protection to the head, chest, and abdomen. Mahindra XUV 3XO scored 43 points out of a possible 49 in the Child Occupant Protection (COP) test. It got a Dynamic score of 24 points (max. 24), a CRS installation score of 12 points (max. 12), and a Vehicle assessment score of 7 points (max. 13). The SUV was crash tested using test dummies for 18-month-old and 3-year-old children. Mahindra XUV 3XO is packed with 35 standard safety features. It features 6 airbags, 3-point seatbelts for all passengers, ISOFIX child seat anchorages, a 360-degree camera, a Blind View Monitor and more. The SUV is also equipped with a Level 2 ADAS package with features like Automatic Emergency Braking (AEB), Lane Departure Warning, and Lane Keep Assist. R Velusamy, President, Automotive Technology and Product Development, Mahindra & Mahindra Ltd. , said, At Mahindra, safety has always been at the core of our product development, and we have trailblazed our way to achieving the highest safety standards on Indian roads. The 5-star Bharat-NCAP ratings for the Thar ROXX, XUV 3XO, and XUV400 reaffirm our mission to create world-class SUVs that offer both outstanding performance and unmatched safety. From pioneering the introduction of six airbags in 2011 to now leading the charge with multiple 5-star-rated vehicles, we continue to set new benchmarks for safety across all segments. As Indias safety norms evolve, Mahindra will continue to push the envelope, ensuring highest safety standards for its SUVs. The Mahindra XUV 3XO compact SUV has scored a 5-star rating in both adult and child occupant protection in Bharat New Car Assessment Program's (BNCAP) safety tests. BNCAP tested the XUV 3XO's AX7 L and MX2 variants but the ratings are applicable on the entire line-up. Apart from the XUV 3XO, BNCAP has also released crash test ratings for the popular Thar Roxx SUV and the XUV400 EV . XUV 3XO gets 29.36 points for adult protection Secures 43 out of 49 points for child protection Thar Roxx, XUV400 BNCAP get high ratings too Mahindra XUV 3XO adult occupant protection The XUV 3XO scored 29.36 points out of 32 in adult occupant protection (AOP). The report noted that the protection offered to the drivers and the passengers head and neck region was good, although protection to the drivers chest was adequate, and left leg was marginal, likely due to impact with the centre console area. The XUV 3XO secured 13.36 out of 16.00 in the frontal offset deformable barrier test. In the side movable deformable barrier test, it secured 16.00 out of 16.00, offering good protection overall. In the side pole impact test, it was rated OK. The XUV 3XO also complied with ESC test requirements. Bharat NCAP, however, does not specify is the body shell was stable and capable of withstanding further loadings. Mahindra XUV 3XO child occupant protection In the child occupant protection, the XUV 3XO secured 43 out of 49 points. It got full points in the dynamic test (24/24) and CRS installation test (12/12) and scored 7 out of 13 in the vehicle assessment test. Both the 18-month-old and the 3-year-old child dummies were tested in rearward-facing child seats positioned in the front passenger seat, secured by ISOFIX anchorages and a support leg. Mahindra XUV 3XO safety features As standard, the XUV 3XO comes equipped with six airbags, three-point seatbelts with reminders for all passengers, Electronic Stability Control (ESC), ISOFIX anchors for rear outboard seats and a passenger-side airbag cut-off switch. The XUV 3XO also complies with AIS-100 pedestrian protection norms. Its top-spec variants even have an ADAS suite. Its direct rival, the Tata Nexon ,was tested by BNCAP last month, and it scored 29.41 out of 32 in AOP and 43.83 out of a maximum possible 49 points for COP. Meanwhile, the XUV 3XO's predecessor, the XUV 300 , had not only secured five stars but it had also registered the highest AOP and COP scores for any made-in-India vehicle tested by Global NCAP back in January 2020. The XUV3XO is the facelift version of the XUV300. Note that the latter has already received a full 5-star rating at the Global NCAP back in 2020. That is what we will base our post on. XUV3XO belongs to one of the most popular market segments in the country. There are tons of compact SUVs in this space including the likes of the Hyundai Venue, Kia Sonet, Tata Nexon, Maruti Brezza and more. Therefore, it is not easy to dominate the competition. As a result, Mahindra offers some of the best-in-segment features to woo the customers. Its safety, striking looks and multiple powertrain options are its strengths. For now, let us take a look at the details of this case. Mahindra XUV3XO Safety Rating In 2020, the Mahindra XUV300 scored 5 stars in the Adult Occupant Protection (AOP) and 4 stars in Child Occupant Protection (COP). Mahindra has always focused on ensuring that its vehicles possess the latest safety equipment. In fact, it was the first SUV in its class to offer 7 airbags. Later, one airbag was removed to control costs. This XUV300 featured ISOFIX child seat mounts, 4-channel ABS, Seatbelt Reminder, Front Seatbelt Pretensioners and dual-airbags (since the base model is tested). Therefore, even the base model was well-kitted when it comes to safety amenities. Mahindra XUV3XO Safety Rating Adult Safety In the AOP category, the XUV3XO secured an almost perfect 16.42 points out of a possible 17. In the crash test, the drivers head displayed good protection, while his chest showed adequate protection. Furthermore, the drivers knees demonstrated good protection and his tibias offered adequate and good protection. Finally, the drivers feet had adequate protection. On the other hand, the passengers head and neck experienced good protection along with the chest. Moreover, the passengers knees and tibias were able to get good protection as well. The bodyshell of the SUV was rated as stable and it was capable of withstanding further loadings. Also, the footwell area was rated as stable. For the Side Impact Regulation UN95, the car met the technical requirements as standard. All these factors contributed to the 5-star safety rating for adult protection. Mahindra XUV3XO Safety Rating Child Safety For the COP section, the child seats were installed for an 18-month-old and a 3-year-old occupant. For the latter, the seat was installed forward-facing with ISOFIX and top tether. It was able to prevent excessive forward movement during the impact. As a result, fair protection was available for the chest. For the younger child, the CRS (Child Restraint System) was installed with ISOFIX and support leg. In this configuration, the protection was good. Furthermore, the recommended CRSs did not show incompatibility. This model didnt offer 3-point seatbelts in all seating positions. The ISOFIX and top tether anchorages were standard in 2 outboard rear seats. Also, the SUV offers the passenger airbag disconnection switch in case a rearward-facing CRS needs to be installed in the front passenger seat. All these aspects ensured a decent 4-star safety rating. At the time, it bagged the highest combined points for any vehicle in India. That is a testament to the fact that it was ahead of the competition since the beginning. Also Read: What is Maruti WagonR Safety Rating by Global NCAP? The SUV was crash-tested by Bharat NCAP in October 2024. This safety rating applies to all variants of the SUV. The 3XO was launched in India in April 2024. Since then, the compact SUV has gained a lot of popularity in the country. The Mahindra Thar Roxx and XUV400 SUVs were also tested by BNCAP and awarded a 5-star rating. Read Also: Buyers face waiting periods of up to 3 months for Tata Curvv Table of Contents - Advertisement - Toggle Mahindra XUV 3XO: Bharat NCAP test results explained Conclusion Mahindra XUV 3XO: Bharat NCAP test results explained Mahindra XUV 3XO scored 29.36 points out of a possible 32 in the Adult Occupants Protection (AOP) test. In the frontal offset deformable test, the SUV offered good protection to the drivers and passengers head, neck, and abdomen. The drivers chest and right leg showed adequate protection while the left leg showed marginal protection. The passengers chest and legs were well protected. In the side movable deformable barrier test and side pole impact test, the SUV offered good protection to the head, chest, and abdomen. Mahindra XUV 3XO scored 43 points out of a possible 49 in the Child Occupant Protection (COP) test. It got a Dynamic score of 24 points (max. 24), a CRS installation score of 12 points (max. 12), and a Vehicle assessment score of 7 points (max. 13). The SUV was crash tested using test dummies for 18-month-old and 3-year-old children. Mahindra XUV 3XO is packed with 35 standard safety features. It features 6 airbags, 3-point seatbelts for all passengers, ISOFIX child seat anchorages, a 360-degree camera, a Blind View Monitor and more. The SUV is also equipped with a Level 2 ADAS package with features like Automatic Emergency Braking (AEB), Lane Departure Warning, and Lane Keep Assist. R Velusamy, President, Automotive Technology and Product Development, Mahindra & Mahindra Ltd. , said, At Mahindra, safety has always been at the core of our product development, and we have trailblazed our way to achieving the highest safety standards on Indian roads. The 5-star Bharat-NCAP ratings for the Thar ROXX, XUV 3XO, and XUV400 reaffirm our mission to create world-class SUVs that offer both outstanding performance and unmatched safety. From pioneering the introduction of six airbags in 2011 to now leading the charge with multiple 5-star-rated vehicles, we continue to set new benchmarks for safety across all segments. As Indias safety norms evolve, Mahindra will continue to push the envelope, ensuring highest safety standards for its SUVs. The Mahindra XUV 3XO compact SUV has scored a 5-star rating in both adult and child occupant protection in Bharat New Car Assessment Program's (BNCAP) safety tests. BNCAP tested the XUV 3XO's AX7 L and MX2 variants but the ratings are applicable on the entire line-up. Apart from the XUV 3XO, BNCAP has also released crash test ratings for the popular Thar Roxx SUV and the XUV400 EV . XUV 3XO gets 29.36 points for adult protection Secures 43 out of 49 points for child protection Thar Roxx, XUV400 BNCAP get high ratings too Mahindra XUV 3XO adult occupant protection The XUV 3XO scored 29.36 points out of 32 in adult occupant protection (AOP). The report noted that the protection offered to the drivers and the passengers head and neck region was good, although protection to the drivers chest was adequate, and left leg was marginal, likely due to impact with the centre console area. The XUV 3XO secured 13.36 out of 16.00 in the frontal offset deformable barrier test. In the side movable deformable barrier test, it secured 16.00 out of 16.00, offering good protection overall. In the side pole impact test, it was rated OK. The XUV 3XO also complied with ESC test requirements. Bharat NCAP, however, does not specify is the body shell was stable and capable of withstanding further loadings. Mahindra XUV 3XO child occupant protection In the child occupant protection, the XUV 3XO secured 43 out of 49 points. It got full points in the dynamic test (24/24) and CRS installation test (12/12) and scored 7 out of 13 in the vehicle assessment test. Both the 18-month-old and the 3-year-old child dummies were tested in rearward-facing child seats positioned in the front passenger seat, secured by ISOFIX anchorages and a support leg. Mahindra XUV 3XO safety features As standard, the XUV 3XO comes equipped with six airbags, three-point seatbelts with reminders for all passengers, Electronic Stability Control (ESC), ISOFIX anchors for rear outboard seats and a passenger-side airbag cut-off switch. The XUV 3XO also complies with AIS-100 pedestrian protection norms. Its top-spec variants even have an ADAS suite. Its direct rival, the Tata Nexon ,was tested by BNCAP last month, and it scored 29.41 out of 32 in AOP and 43.83 out of a maximum possible 49 points for COP. Meanwhile, the XUV 3XO's predecessor, the XUV 300 , had not only secured five stars but it had also registered the highest AOP and COP scores for any made-in-India vehicle tested by Global NCAP back in January 2020. (M&M Ltd.), one of Indias leading automotive companies, today announced that its overall auto sales for the month of October 2024 stood at 96648 vehicles, including exports. In the Utility Vehicles segment, Mahindra sold 54504 vehicles in the domestic market, a growth of 25% and overall, 55571 vehicles, including exports. The domestic sales for Commercial Vehicles stood at 28812. According to Veejay Nakra, President, Automotive Division, M&M Ltd., We are excited to have clocked the highest-ever SUV sales of 54504 vehicles in October, a growth of 25% and highest ever total volume of 96648, a growth of 20%. The month began on a fantastic note with Thar ROXX garnering 1.7lakh bookings in the first 60mins and the positive momentum continued across the SUV portfolio through the festive season. Mahindra records highest-ever sales of 54,504 units in October 2024 Homegrown SUV maker is seeing rising demand thanks to popular models like the Thar Roxx and XUV 3XO, among others. Published On Nov 04, 2024 12:07:00 PM 10,015 Views Follow us on Recently launched Thar Roxx among Mahindra's popular models. By Akbar Merchant Share - Listen to this Article Your browser does not support the audio element. Mahindra recorded its highest-ever monthly SUV sales of 54,504 units in October, up from 51,062 units in the previous month. The companys year-to-date performance remains strong, with total SUV sales reaching 3,14,714 units, representing a 22 percent growth compared to the previous twelve months. Mahindra exported 3,506 units in October XUV 3XO sales average 9,000-10,000 units a month Mahindra's performance was highlighted by strong demand across its SUV portfolio during the festive season. Some of its models, such as the Thar Roxx, have been doing exceptionally well. The demand for the Roxx crossed 1.76 lakh units within an hour of its bookings opening. Deliveries for the Thar Roxx have commenced in phases, and some buyers have a delivery timeline as late as May 2026 . In addition to the domestic SUV sales, Mahindras export figures stood at 3,506 units, marking an 89 percent increase compared to the previous year. Another popular model from Mahindra, the XUV 3XO, saw average monthly sales in the range of 9,000-10,000 units. The waiting period for the Kia Sonet and Hyundai Venue rival is as high as six months for some variants. XUV 3XO Report

Executive Summary Market Analysis Features Safety Sales Data
☰ Mahindra XUV 3XO Report

Executive Summary

The SUV market has shown robust growth in recent years, driven by increasing consumer preference for versatility, safety, and comfort. The Mahindra XUV 3XO is a significant player in the sub-compact SUV segment, offering a compelling combination of features, performance, and safety. Recent sales data indicates strong demand for the XUV 3XO, supported by its competitive pricing and positive reviews.

This section provides a high-level overview of the SUV market and the Mahindra XUV 3XO's position within it. Key insights and strategic implications are highlighted to provide a concise summary.

  • SUV market continues to expand with electric and hybrid models.
  • Mahindra XUV 3XO offers a fresh look to the segment.
  • XUV 3XO sales are robust, driven by competitive pricing.
  • Mahindra focuses on integrating advanced technology into SUVs.
Month Sales No.
Jan 20258,454
Feb 20257,861
Mar 20257,055
Apr 20257,568
May 20257,952
Jun 20257,089
Mahindra XUV 3XO Soft touch material on dashboard and door pads.

Market Analysis

The SUV market is segmented by type (Compact SUVs, Mid-Size SUVs, Full-Size SUVs, Luxury SUVs, Electric SUVs, Hybrid SUVs), by fuel type (Gasoline SUVs, Diesel SUVs, Electric SUVs, Hybrid SUVs), by drivetrain, by seating capacity, and by application (Personal Use SUVs, Commercial Use SUVs, Off-Road SUVs). The global SUV market was valued at USD 1.36 Trillion in 2024 and is projected to reach a value of USD 2.2 Trillion by 2032, expanding at a compound annual growth rate (CAGR) of 6% during the forecast period.

This section analyzes the overall SUV market dynamics, including size, growth, segmentation, and key trends.

  • Global SUV market valued at USD 1.36 Trillion in 2024.
  • Projected to reach USD 2.2 Trillion by 2032.
  • Expanding at a CAGR of 6% during the forecast period.
  • Market driven by urbanization and rising disposable income.

Features

The Mahindra XUV 3XO has 1 Diesel Engine and 1 Petrol Engine on offer. The Diesel engine is 1498 cc while the Petrol engine is 1197 cc . It is available with Manual & Automatic transmission.Depending upon the variant and fuel type the XUV 3XO has a mileage of 17.96 to 20.6 kmpl. The XUV 3XO is a 5 seater 3 cylinder car and has length of 3990 mm, width of 1821 mm and a wheelbase of 2600.

  • Soft touch material on dashboard and door pads.
  • Panoramic sunroof - largest in the segment.
  • Level 2 ADAS with features such as forward collision warning, adaptive cruise control.
  • 1.2-litre turbo-petrol engine makes 130PS/230Nm most powerful in its class.

Safety

The Mahindra XUV 3XO has secured a 5-star safety rating from Bharat NCAP. The SUV was crash-tested by Bharat NCAP in October 2024. The XUV 3XO scored 29.36 points out of 32 in adult occupant protection and 43 points out of 49 in child occupant protection.

  • 5-star rating for adult occupant protection.
  • Child occupant protection receives 5-star rating.
  • Standard safety features include 6 airbags, ESC, reverse parking sensors, & more.
  • Level 2 ADAS available.

Sales Data

In June 2025, the total sales figure of XUV 3XO was 7,089 units, which is a 10.85 percent MoM decline. In December 2024, XUV3XO witnessed a staggering growth of 97.18%, with sales of 7,000 units in December 2024 compared to 3,550 units in December 2023.

  • XUV 3XO sales: 7,089 units in June 2025.
  • December 2024 sales up 97.18% YoY.
  • High demand for the model.
  • Sales impacted by market conditions.

report_sections.heading: Executive Summary
report_sections.content: The SUV market has shown robust growth in recent years, driven by increasing consumer preference for versatility, safety, and comfort. The Mahindra XUV 3XO is a significant player in the sub-compact SUV segment, offering a compelling combination of features, performance, and safety. Recent sales data indicates strong demand for the XUV 3XO, supported by its competitive pricing and positive reviews.
report_sections.descriptive_text: This section provides a high-level overview of the SUV market and the Mahindra XUV 3XO's position within it. Key insights and strategic implications are highlighted to provide a concise summary.
bullet_points: SUV market continues to expand with electric and hybrid models.
Mahindra XUV 3XO offers a fresh look to the segment.
XUV 3XO sales are robust, driven by competitive pricing.
Mahindra focuses on integrating advanced technology into SUVs.

report_sections.heading: Market Analysis
report_sections.content: The SUV market is segmented by type (Compact SUVs, Mid-Size SUVs, Full-Size SUVs, Luxury SUVs, Electric SUVs, Hybrid SUVs), by fuel type (Gasoline SUVs, Diesel SUVs, Electric SUVs, Hybrid SUVs), by drivetrain, by seating capacity, and by application (Personal Use SUVs, Commercial Use SUVs, Off-Road SUVs).  The global SUV market was valued at USD 1.36 Trillion in 2024 and is projected to reach a value of USD 2.2 Trillion by 2032, expanding at a compound annual growth rate (CAGR) of 6% during the forecast period.
report_sections.descriptive_text: This section analyzes the overall SUV market dynamics, including size, growth, segmentation, and key trends.
bullet_points: Global SUV market valued at USD 1.36 Trillion in 2024.
Projected to reach USD 2.2 Trillion by 2032.
Expanding at a CAGR of 6% during the forecast period.
Market driven by urbanization and rising disposable income.

report_sections.heading: Funding Analysis
report_sections.content: While specific funding data for the Mahindra XUV 3XO is not available, the broader SUV market has seen significant investment in electric and hybrid models. Automakers are integrating advanced technology into SUVs, enhancing safety, connectivity, and performance.  The shift towards electric SUVs is driven by consumer demand for fuel-efficient and environmentally friendly options.
report_sections.descriptive_text: This section analyzes the investment patterns and trends within the SUV market, with a focus on electric and hybrid vehicle development.
bullet_points: Significant investment in electric and hybrid SUV models.
Automakers enhancing safety and connectivity features.
Consumer demand driving the shift towards electric SUVs.
Focus on lightweight materials and aerodynamic designs.

report_sections.heading: Technology Breakdown
report_sections.content: The Mahindra XUV 3XO is equipped with state-of-the-art technology, including Level 2 ADAS, a Harman Kardon 7-speaker audio system, and a high-definition touchscreen system for infotainment and navigation. Connectivity features include built-in Amazon Alexa and ADRENOX Connect technology. The vehicle also boasts a 360-degree camera and a blind view monitor for enhanced safety.
report_sections.descriptive_text: This section breaks down the key technology features of the Mahindra XUV 3XO, focusing on ADAS, connectivity, and safety systems.
bullet_points: Level 2 Advanced Driver Assistance Systems (ADAS).
Harman Kardon 7-speaker audio system.
High-definition touchscreen system for infotainment and navigation.
Built-in Amazon Alexa and ADRENOX Connect technology.

report_sections.heading: Geographic Distribution
report_sections.content: The Mahindra XUV 3XO is primarily targeted at the Indian market, with potential for expansion into other emerging markets. Rising urbanization and changing lifestyles have led many families to seek vehicles that offer both comfort and functionality. Automakers are also developing compact and urban-friendly SUV models to cater to city dwellers.
report_sections.descriptive_text: This section analyzes the geographic distribution of the Mahindra XUV 3XO and its target markets.
bullet_points: Primarily targeted at the Indian market.

Rising urbanization driving demand for SUVs in cities.
Compact and urban-friendly SUV models gaining popularity.

report_sections.heading: Company Profiles
report_sections.content: Mahindra & Mahindra Ltd. is one of India's leading automotive companies. It is known for its focus on innovation, safety, and customer satisfaction. Mahindra is committed to creating world-class SUVs that offer both outstanding performance and unmatched safety. The company is also investing in electric vehicle technology to address environmental concerns and comply with stricter emissions regulations.

bullet_points: Leading automotive company in India.

Investing in electric vehicle technology.

report_sections.heading: Competitive Landscape
report_sections.content: The Mahindra XUV 3XO competes with other sub-compact SUVs in the Indian market, including the Maruti Suzuki Brezza, Hyundai Venue, Kia Sonet, Tata Nexon, Renault Kiger, Toyota Urban Cruiser Taisor, Maruti Suzuki Fronx, and Nissan Magnite.  The XUV 3XO offers a competitive edge with its advanced features, safety ratings, and performance.

report_sections.heading: Risk Assessment
report_sections.content: Despite advancements in fuel efficiency and the emergence of electric SUVs, environmental concerns regarding greenhouse gas emissions and fuel consumption remain significant. Stricter emissions regulations imposed by governments worldwide may limit the appeal of traditional gas-powered SUVs, leading to increased scrutiny and potential restrictions on their sales and usage.

report_sections.content: To maintain and enhance its market position, Mahindra should continue to invest in electric and hybrid technology, improve fuel efficiency, enhance safety features, and expand its geographic reach. It should also focus on customer satisfaction and brand building to strengthen its competitive advantage.

Home Car News Bike News EV News Comparisons Featured About Privacy No Result View All Result Home Car News Bike News EV News Comparisons Featured About Privacy No Result View All Result No Result View All Result What is Mahindra XUV3XOs Safety Rating? by Harsh Kashyap 1 year ago in Featured A A A A Reset Mahindra XUV300 Global NCAP Safety Rating The next topic in this series is Mahindra XUV3XO safety rating. The XUV3XO is the facelift version of the XUV300. Note that the latter has already received a full 5-star rating at the Global NCAP back in 2020. That is what we will base our post on. XUV3XO belongs to one of the most popular market segments in the country. There are tons of compact SUVs in this space including the likes of the Hyundai Venue, Kia Sonet, Tata Nexon, Maruti Brezza and more. Therefore, it is not easy to dominate the competition. As a result, Mahindra offers some of the best-in-segment features to woo the customers. Its safety, striking looks and multiple powertrain options are its strengths. For now, let us take a look at the details of this case. Mahindra XUV3XO Safety Rating In 2020, the Mahindra XUV300 scored 5 stars in the Adult Occupant Protection (AOP) and 4 stars in Child Occupant Protection (COP). Mahindra has always focused on ensuring that its vehicles possess the latest safety equipment. In fact, it was the first SUV in its class to offer 7 airbags. Later, one airbag was removed to control costs. This XUV300 featured ISOFIX child seat mounts, 4-channel ABS, Seatbelt Reminder, Front Seatbelt Pretensioners and dual-airbags (since the base model is tested). Therefore, even the base model was well-kitted when it comes to safety amenities. Mahindra XUV3XO Safety Rating Adult Safety In the AOP category, the XUV3XO secured an almost perfect 16.42 points out of a possible 17. In the crash test, the drivers head displayed good protection, while his chest showed adequate protection. Furthermore, the drivers knees demonstrated good protection and his tibias offered adequate and good protection. Finally, the drivers feet had adequate protection. On the other hand, the passengers head and neck experienced good protection along with the chest. Moreover, the passengers knees and tibias were able to get good protection as well. The bodyshell of the SUV was rated as stable and it was capable of withstanding further loadings. Also, the footwell area was rated as stable. For the Side Impact Regulation UN95, the car met the technical requirements as standard. All these factors contributed to the 5-star safety rating for adult protection. Mahindra XUV3XO Safety Rating Child Safety For the COP section, the child seats were installed for an 18-month-old and a 3-year-old occupant. For the latter, the seat was installed forward-facing with ISOFIX and top tether. It was able to prevent excessive forward movement during the impact. As a result, fair protection was available for the chest. For the younger child, the CRS (Child Restraint System) was installed with ISOFIX and support leg. In this configuration, the protection was good. Furthermore, the recommended CRSs did not show incompatibility. This model didnt offer 3-point seatbelts in all seating positions. The ISOFIX and top tether anchorages were standard in 2 outboard rear seats. Also, the SUV offers the passenger airbag disconnection switch in case a rearward-facing CRS needs to be installed in the front passenger seat. All these aspects ensured a decent 4-star safety rating. At the time, it bagged the highest combined points for any vehicle in India. That is a testament to the fact that it was ahead of the competition since the beginning. Also Read: What is Maruti WagonR Safety Rating by Global NCAP? Mahindra XUV3XO Safety Features Now while these tests were conducted on the pre-facelift model, the current version comes with additional safety tech and amenities. Mahindra constantly evolves to offer buyers the latest', 'images': [{'url': 'https://www.carblogindia.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/06/mahindra-xuv300-safety-rating-global-ncap-750x422.jpg', 'alt_text': 'Mahindra XUV300 Global NCAP Safety Rating', 'width': '750', 'height': '422', 'class': 'attachment-jnews-featured-750 size-jnews-featured-750 wp-post-image', 'confidence': 1.0}], 'rank': 3}, {'url': 'https://motorbridge.com/car-news/mahindra-xuv-3xo-scores-5-stars-bncap/', 'content': 'Mahindra XUV 3XO scores 5 stars in Bharat NCAP crash tests - Motor Bridge Car News Bike News Reviews Car Reviews Bike Reviews Auto Features Car Comparison Bike Comparison Tech News Search Style News About Us Write For Us Privacy Policy Contact Us Accessibility Terms Of Use Tech News Search Search Facebook RSS Twitter Car News Bike News Reviews Car Reviews Bike Reviews Auto Features Car Comparison Bike Comparison Tech News Car News Bike News Reviews Car Reviews Bike Reviews Auto Features Car Comparison Bike Comparison Tech News More Search Search Home Car News Mahindra XUV 3XO scores 5 stars in Bharat NCAP crash tests Read along to view the test results. Utkarsh Joshi November 14, 2024 Share Facebook Twitter WhatsApp Linkedin ReddIt Email Print Telegram Advertisment Mahindra XUV 3XO has secured a 5-star safety rating from Bharat NCAP. The SUV was crash-tested by Bharat NCAP in October 2024. This safety rating applies to all variants of the SUV. The 3XO was launched in India in April 2024. Since then, the compact SUV has gained a lot of popularity in the country. The Mahindra Thar Roxx and XUV400 SUVs were also tested by BNCAP and awarded a 5-star rating. Read Also: Buyers face waiting periods of up to 3 months for Tata Curvv Table of Contents - Advertisement - Toggle Mahindra XUV 3XO: Bharat NCAP test results explained Conclusion Mahindra XUV 3XO: Bharat NCAP test results explained Mahindra XUV 3XO scored 29.36 points out of a possible 32 in the Adult Occupants Protection (AOP) test. In the frontal offset deformable test, the SUV offered good protection to the drivers and passengers head, neck, and abdomen. The drivers chest and right leg showed adequate protection while the left leg showed marginal protection. The passengers chest and legs were well protected. In the side movable deformable barrier test and side pole impact test, the SUV offered good protection to the head, chest, and abdomen. Mahindra XUV 3XO scored 43 points out of a possible 49 in the Child Occupant Protection (COP) test. It got a Dynamic score of 24 points (max. 24), a CRS installation score of 12 points (max. 12), and a Vehicle assessment score of 7 points (max. 13). The SUV was crash tested using test dummies for 18-month-old and 3-year-old children. Mahindra XUV 3XO is packed with 35 standard safety features. It features 6 airbags, 3-point seatbelts for all passengers, ISOFIX child seat anchorages, a 360-degree camera, a Blind View Monitor and more. The SUV is also equipped with a Level 2 ADAS package with features like Automatic Emergency Braking (AEB), Lane Departure Warning, and Lane Keep Assist. R Velusamy, President, Automotive Technology and Product Development, Mahindra & Mahindra Ltd. , said, At Mahindra, safety has always been at the core of our product development, and we have trailblazed our way to achieving the highest safety standards on Indian roads. The 5-star Bharat-NCAP ratings for the Thar ROXX, XUV 3XO, and XUV400 reaffirm our mission to create world-class SUVs that offer both outstanding performance and unmatched safety. From pioneering the introduction of six airbags in 2011 to now leading the charge with multiple 5-star-rated vehicles, we continue to set new benchmarks for safety across all segments. As Indias safety norms evolve, Mahindra will continue to push the envelope, ensuring highest safety standards for its SUVs. Read Also: New design sketches revealed for upcoming 3rd-gen Honda Amaze Conclusion Prices for the Mahindra XUV 3XO start at Rs 7.79 lakh and go up to Rs 15.49 lakh. It rivals the likes of the Maruti Suzuki Brezza , Hyundai Venue facelift , Kia Sonet , Tata Nexon , Renault Kiger , Toyota Urban Cruiser Taisor , Maruti Suzuki Fronx , and Nissan Magnite . - Pune Hyderabad Ahmedabad Chennai Kolkata Home Car News Mahindra XUV 3XO scores 5 star Bharat NCAP rating Mahindra XUV 3XO scores 5 star Bharat NCAP rating Mahindra XUV 3XO adult and child occupant protection scores are almost identical to the Tata Nexon. Published On Nov 14, 2024 11:10:00 AM 17,475 Views Follow us on By Akbar Merchant Share - Listen to this Article Your browser does not support the audio element. The Mahindra XUV 3XO compact SUV has scored a 5-star rating in both adult and child occupant protection in Bharat New Car Assessment Program's (BNCAP) safety tests. BNCAP tested the XUV 3XO's AX7 L and MX2 variants but the ratings are applicable on the entire line-up. Apart from the XUV 3XO, BNCAP has also released crash test ratings for the popular Thar Roxx SUV and the XUV400 EV . XUV 3XO gets 29.36 points for adult protection Secures 43 out of 49 points for child protection Thar Roxx, XUV400 BNCAP get high ratings too Mahindra XUV 3XO adult occupant protection The XUV 3XO scored 29.36 points out of 32 in adult occupant protection (AOP). The report noted that the protection offered to the drivers and the passengers head and neck region was good, although protection to the drivers chest was adequate, and left leg was marginal, likely due to impact with the centre console area. The XUV 3XO secured 13.36 out of 16.00 in the frontal offset deformable barrier test. In the side movable deformable barrier test, it secured 16.00 out of 16.00, offering good protection overall. In the side pole impact test, it was rated OK. The XUV 3XO also complied with ESC test requirements. Bharat NCAP, however, does not specify is the body shell was stable and capable of withstanding further loadings. Mahindra XUV 3XO child occupant protection In the child occupant protection, the XUV 3XO secured 43 out of 49 points. It got full points in the dynamic test (24/24) and CRS installation test (12/12) and scored 7 out of 13 in the vehicle assessment test. Both the 18-month-old and the 3-year-old child dummies were tested in rearward-facing child seats positioned in the front passenger seat, secured by ISOFIX anchorages and a support leg. Mahindra XUV 3XO safety features As standard, the XUV 3XO comes equipped with six airbags, three-point seatbelts with reminders for all passengers, Electronic Stability Control (ESC), ISOFIX anchors for rear outboard seats and a passenger-side airbag cut-off switch. The XUV 3XO also complies with AIS-100 pedestrian protection norms. Its top-spec variants even have an ADAS suite. Its direct rival, the Tata Nexon ,was tested by BNCAP last month, and it scored 29.41 out of 32 in AOP and 43.83 out of a maximum possible 49 points for COP. Meanwhile, the XUV 3XO's predecessor, the XUV 300 , had not only secured five stars but it had also registered the highest AOP and COP scores for any made-in-India vehicle tested by Global NCAP back in January 2020. The XUV3XO is the facelift version of the XUV300. Note that the latter has already received a full 5-star rating at the Global NCAP back in 2020. That is what we will base our post on. XUV3XO belongs to one of the most popular market segments in the country. There are tons of compact SUVs in this space including the likes of the Hyundai Venue, Kia Sonet, Tata Nexon, Maruti Brezza and more. Therefore, it is not easy to dominate the competition. As a result, Mahindra offers some of the best-in-segment features to woo the customers. Its safety, striking looks and multiple powertrain options are its strengths. For now, let us take a look at the details of this case. Mahindra XUV3XO Safety Rating In 2020, the Mahindra XUV300 scored 5 stars in the Adult Occupant Protection (AOP) and 4 stars in Child Occupant Protection (COP). Mahindra has always focused on ensuring that its vehicles possess the latest safety equipment. In fact, it was the first SUV in its class to offer 7 airbags. Later, one airbag was removed to control costs. This XUV300 featured ISOFIX child seat mounts, 4-channel ABS, Seatbelt Reminder, Front Seatbelt Pretensioners and dual-airbags (since the base model is tested). Therefore, even the base model was well-kitted when it comes to safety amenities. Mahindra XUV3XO Safety Rating Adult Safety In the AOP category, the XUV3XO secured an almost perfect 16.42 points out of a possible 17. In the crash test, the drivers head displayed good protection, while his chest showed adequate protection. Furthermore, the drivers knees demonstrated good protection and his tibias offered adequate and good protection. Finally, the drivers feet had adequate protection. On the other hand, the passengers head and neck experienced good protection along with the chest. Moreover, the passengers knees and tibias were able to get good protection as well. The bodyshell of the SUV was rated as stable and it was capable of withstanding further loadings. Also, the footwell area was rated as stable. For the Side Impact Regulation UN95, the car met the technical requirements as standard. All these factors contributed to the 5-star safety rating for adult protection. Mahindra XUV3XO Safety Rating Child Safety For the COP section, the child seats were installed for an 18-month-old and a 3-year-old occupant. For the latter, the seat was installed forward-facing with ISOFIX and top tether. It was able to prevent excessive forward movement during the impact. As a result, fair protection was available for the chest. For the younger child, the CRS (Child Restraint System) was installed with ISOFIX and support leg. In this configuration, the protection was good. Furthermore, the recommended CRSs did not show incompatibility. This model didnt offer 3-point seatbelts in all seating positions. The ISOFIX and top tether anchorages were standard in 2 outboard rear seats. Also, the SUV offers the passenger airbag disconnection switch in case a rearward-facing CRS needs to be installed in the front passenger seat. All these aspects ensured a decent 4-star safety rating. At the time, it bagged the highest combined points for any vehicle in India. That is a testament to the fact that it was ahead of the competition since the beginning. Also Read: What is Maruti WagonR Safety Rating by Global NCAP? Mahindra XUV3XO Safety Features Now while these tests were conducted on the pre-facelift model, the current version comes with additional safety tech and amenities. Utkarsh Joshi November 14, 2024 Share Facebook Twitter WhatsApp Linkedin ReddIt Email Print Telegram Advertisment Mahindra XUV 3XO has secured a 5-star safety rating from Bharat NCAP. The SUV was crash-tested by Bharat NCAP in October 2024. This safety rating applies to all variants of the SUV. The 3XO was launched in India in April 2024. Since then, the compact SUV has gained a lot of popularity in the country. The Mahindra Thar Roxx and XUV400 SUVs were also tested by BNCAP and awarded a 5-star rating. Read Also: Buyers face waiting periods of up to 3 months for Tata Curvv Table of Contents - Advertisement - Toggle Mahindra XUV 3XO: Bharat NCAP test results explained Conclusion Mahindra XUV 3XO: Bharat NCAP test results explained Mahindra XUV 3XO scored 29.36 points out of a possible 32 in the Adult Occupants Protection (AOP) test. In the frontal offset deformable test, the SUV offered good protection to the drivers and passengers head, neck, and abdomen. The drivers chest and right leg showed adequate protection while the left leg showed marginal protection. The passengers chest and legs were well protected. In the side movable deformable barrier test and side pole impact test, the SUV offered good protection to the head, chest, and abdomen. Mahindra XUV 3XO scored 43 points out of a possible 49 in the Child Occupant Protection (COP) test. It got a Dynamic score of 24 points (max. 24), a CRS installation score of 12 points (max. 12), and a Vehicle assessment score of 7 points (max. 13). The SUV was crash tested using test dummies for 18-month-old and 3-year-old children. Mahindra XUV 3XO is packed with 35 standard safety features. It features 6 airbags, 3-point seatbelts for all passengers, ISOFIX child seat anchorages, a 360-degree camera, a Blind View Monitor and more. The SUV is also equipped with a Level 2 ADAS package with features like Automatic Emergency Braking (AEB), Lane Departure Warning, and Lane Keep Assist. R Velusamy, President, Automotive Technology and Product Development, Mahindra & Mahindra Ltd. , said, At Mahindra, safety has always been at the core of our product development, and we have trailblazed our way to achieving the highest safety standards on Indian roads. The 5-star Bharat-NCAP ratings for the Thar ROXX, XUV 3XO, and XUV400 reaffirm our mission to create world-class SUVs that offer both outstanding performance and unmatched safety. From pioneering the introduction of six airbags in 2011 to now leading the charge with multiple 5-star-rated vehicles, we continue to set new benchmarks for safety across all segments. As Indias safety norms evolve, Mahindra will continue to push the envelope, ensuring highest safety standards for its SUVs. Published On Nov 14, 2024 11:10:00 AM 17,475 Views Follow us on By Akbar Merchant Share - Listen to this Article Your browser does not support the audio element. The Mahindra XUV 3XO compact SUV has scored a 5-star rating in both adult and child occupant protection in Bharat New Car Assessment Program's (BNCAP) safety tests. BNCAP tested the XUV 3XO's AX7 L and MX2 variants but the ratings are applicable on the entire line-up. Apart from the XUV 3XO, BNCAP has also released crash test ratings for the popular Thar Roxx SUV and the XUV400 EV . XUV 3XO gets 29.36 points for adult protection Secures 43 out of 49 points for child protection Thar Roxx, XUV400 BNCAP get high ratings too Mahindra XUV 3XO adult occupant protection The XUV 3XO scored 29.36 points out of 32 in adult occupant protection (AOP). The report noted that the protection offered to the drivers and the passengers head and neck region was good, although protection to the drivers chest was adequate, and left leg was marginal, likely due to impact with the centre console area. The XUV 3XO secured 13.36 out of 16.00 in the frontal offset deformable barrier test. In the side movable deformable barrier test, it secured 16.00 out of 16.00, offering good protection overall. In the side pole impact test, it was rated OK. The XUV 3XO also complied with ESC test requirements. Bharat NCAP, however, does not specify is the body shell was stable and capable of withstanding further loadings. Mahindra XUV 3XO child occupant protection In the child occupant protection, the XUV 3XO secured 43 out of 49 points. It got full points in the dynamic test (24/24) and CRS installation test (12/12) and scored 7 out of 13 in the vehicle assessment test. Both the 18-month-old and the 3-year-old child dummies were tested in rearward-facing child seats positioned in the front passenger seat, secured by ISOFIX anchorages and a support leg. Mahindra XUV 3XO safety features As standard, the XUV 3XO comes equipped with six airbags, three-point seatbelts with reminders for all passengers, Electronic Stability Control (ESC), ISOFIX anchors for rear outboard seats and a passenger-side airbag cut-off switch. The XUV 3XO also complies with AIS-100 pedestrian protection norms. Its top-spec variants even have an ADAS suite. Its direct rival, the Tata Nexon ,was tested by BNCAP last month, and it scored 29.41 out of 32 in AOP and 43.83 out of a maximum possible 49 points for COP. Meanwhile, the XUV 3XO's predecessor, the XUV 300 , had not only secured five stars but it had also registered the highest AOP and COP scores for any made-in-India vehicle tested by Global NCAP back in January 2020. The XUV 3XO secured this accolade for both adult and child occupant protection, underlining Mahindras focus on providing world-class safety features in its vehicles. This latest recognition comes on the heels of Bharat NCAP's recent safety assessments of other prominent SUVs, including Tata models and the Citroen Basalt, as well as Mahindras own Thar Roxx and XUV 400 EV, both of which also earned 5-star ratings. The XUV 3XO demonstrated strong safety performance in multiple areas of testing. It achieved a remarkable total score of 29.36 out of 32 for adult occupant protection. In the frontal offset deformable barrier test, the SUV exhibited excellent protection for the co-driver, with good ratings across all body regions. However, the driver's chest, legs, and feet received ratings of adequate to marginal due to the impact forces recorded during the collision. Despite these minor deductions, protection to the driver's head, hip, and thigh was rated as good, reinforcing the XUV 3XOs overall structural integrity and crashworthiness. The XUV 3XO excelled in the side barrier and pole impact tests, securing a full 16 out of 16 points . These tests assess the SUVs ability to protect front-seat occupants in scenarios where side impacts pose a significant threat. Mahindras engineering expertise was evident, as the SUV delivered comprehensive protection to the head, chest, abdomen, and pelvis, showcasing its robust design and stringent safety standards. In terms of child occupant safety, the XUV 3XO also performed admirably, earning a total score of 43 out of 49 . While the SUV dropped a few points in the vehicle assessment score, it still received full marks in both the dynamic crash test and the child restraint system (CRS) parameters. The test evaluated the ability of child restraint systems to effectively secure young passengers during high-impact situations. The XUV 3XO accommodated CRS installations with ease, ensuring full protection for child passengers. Bharat NCAP tested both the fully loaded AX7 L variant and the entry-level MX2 variant of the XUV 3XO. The safety ratings are applicable across all variants, reflecting Mahindras commitment to offering consistent safety standards, regardless of trim level. The XUV 3XOs impressive safety performance is backed by a comprehensive suite of standard safety features. The SUV comes equipped with six airbags as a standard offering across all trims, ensuring superior protection for all occupants. Additionally, Electronic Stability Control (ESC) and Anti-lock Braking System (ABS) are standard, enhancing the vehicles stability and control in various driving conditions. Seat belt reminders are also provided for all seating positions, encouraging passengers to use seat belts at all times and thereby boosting overall safety. For customers opting for the higher-end variants, Mahindra offers Level 2 Advanced Driver Assistance Systems (ADAS) . This package includes features such as adaptive cruise control, lane-keeping assist, and autonomous emergency braking, adding another layer of safety and convenience for drivers. These technologies are designed to mitigate the risk of collisions and assist drivers in maintaining optimal control over the vehicle. The XUV 3XOs success in the Bharat NCAP crash tests is a testament to Mahindras dedication to vehicle safety. Home Car News Bike News EV News Comparisons Featured About Privacy No Result View All Result Home Car News Bike News EV News Comparisons Featured About Privacy No Result View All Result No Result View All Result What is Mahindra XUV3XOs Safety Rating? by Harsh Kashyap 1 year ago in Featured A A A A Reset Mahindra XUV300 Global NCAP Safety Rating The next topic in this series is Mahindra XUV3XO safety rating. The XUV3XO is the facelift version of the XUV300. Note that the latter has already received a full 5-star rating at the Global NCAP back in 2020. That is what we will base our post on. XUV3XO belongs to one of the most popular market segments in the country. There are tons of compact SUVs in this space including the likes of the Hyundai Venue, Kia Sonet, Tata Nexon, Maruti Brezza and more. Therefore, it is not easy to dominate the competition. As a result, Mahindra offers some of the best-in-segment features to woo the customers. Its safety, striking looks and multiple powertrain options are its strengths. For now, let us take a look at the details of this case. Mahindra XUV3XO Safety Rating In 2020, the Mahindra XUV300 scored 5 stars in the Adult Occupant Protection (AOP) and 4 stars in Child Occupant Protection (COP). Mahindra has always focused on ensuring that its vehicles possess the latest safety equipment. In fact, it was the first SUV in its class to offer 7 airbags. Later, one airbag was removed to control costs. This XUV300 featured ISOFIX child seat mounts, 4-channel ABS, Seatbelt Reminder, Front Seatbelt Pretensioners and dual-airbags (since the base model is tested). Therefore, even the base model was well-kitted when it comes to safety amenities. Mahindra XUV3XO Safety Rating Adult Safety In the AOP category, the XUV3XO secured an almost perfect 16.42 points out of a possible 17. In the crash test, the drivers head displayed good protection, while his chest showed adequate protection. Furthermore, the drivers knees demonstrated good protection and his tibias offered adequate and good protection. Finally, the drivers feet had adequate protection. On the other hand, the passengers head and neck experienced good protection along with the chest. Moreover, the passengers knees and tibias were able to get good protection as well. The bodyshell of the SUV was rated as stable and it was capable of withstanding further loadings. Also, the footwell area was rated as stable. For the Side Impact Regulation UN95, the car met the technical requirements as standard. All these factors contributed to the 5-star safety rating for adult protection. Mahindra XUV3XO Safety Rating Child Safety For the COP section, the child seats were installed for an 18-month-old and a 3-year-old occupant. For the latter, the seat was installed forward-facing with ISOFIX and top tether. It was able to prevent excessive forward movement during the impact. As a result, fair protection was available for the chest. For the younger child, the CRS (Child Restraint System) was installed with ISOFIX and support leg. In this configuration, the protection was good. Furthermore, the recommended CRSs did not show incompatibility. This model didnt offer 3-point seatbelts in all seating positions. The ISOFIX and top tether anchorages were standard in 2 outboard rear seats. Also, the SUV offers the passenger airbag disconnection switch in case a rearward-facing CRS needs to be installed in the front passenger seat. Home Car News Bike News EV News Comparisons Featured About Privacy No Result View All Result Home Car News Bike News EV News Comparisons Featured About Privacy No Result View All Result No Result View All Result What is Mahindra XUV3XOs Safety Rating? by Harsh Kashyap 1 year ago in Featured A A A A Reset Mahindra XUV300 Global NCAP Safety Rating The next topic in this series is Mahindra XUV3XO safety rating. The XUV3XO is the facelift version of the XUV300. Note that the latter has already received a full 5-star rating at the Global NCAP back in 2020. That is what we will base our post on. XUV3XO belongs to one of the most popular market segments in the country. There are tons of compact SUVs in this space including the likes of the Hyundai Venue, Kia Sonet, Tata Nexon, Maruti Brezza and more. Therefore, it is not easy to dominate the competition. As a result, Mahindra offers some of the best-in-segment features to woo the customers. Its safety, striking looks and multiple powertrain options are its strengths. For now, let us take a look at the details of this case. Mahindra XUV3XO Safety Rating In 2020, the Mahindra XUV300 scored 5 stars in the Adult Occupant Protection (AOP) and 4 stars in Child Occupant Protection (COP). Mahindra has always focused on ensuring that its vehicles possess the latest safety equipment. In fact, it was the first SUV in its class to offer 7 airbags. Later, one airbag was removed to control costs. This XUV300 featured ISOFIX child seat mounts, 4-channel ABS, Seatbelt Reminder, Front Seatbelt Pretensioners and dual-airbags (since the base model is tested). Therefore, even the base model was well-kitted when it comes to safety amenities. Mahindra XUV3XO Safety Rating Adult Safety In the AOP category, the XUV3XO secured an almost perfect 16.42 points out of a possible 17. In the crash test, the drivers head displayed good protection, while his chest showed adequate protection. Furthermore, the drivers knees demonstrated good protection and his tibias offered adequate and good protection. Finally, the drivers feet had adequate protection. On the other hand, the passengers head and neck experienced good protection along with the chest. Moreover, the passengers knees and tibias were able to get good protection as well. The bodyshell of the SUV was rated as stable and it was capable of withstanding further loadings. Also, the footwell area was rated as stable. For the Side Impact Regulation UN95, the car met the technical requirements as standard. All these factors contributed to the 5-star safety rating for adult protection. Mahindra XUV3XO Safety Rating Child Safety For the COP section, the child seats were installed for an 18-month-old and a 3-year-old occupant. For the latter, the seat was installed forward-facing with ISOFIX and top tether. It was able to prevent excessive forward movement during the impact. As a result, fair protection was available for the chest. For the younger child, the CRS (Child Restraint System) was installed with ISOFIX and support leg. In this configuration, the protection was good. Furthermore, the recommended CRSs did not show incompatibility. This model didnt offer 3-point seatbelts in all seating positions. The ISOFIX and top tether anchorages were standard in 2 outboard rear seats. Also, the SUV offers the passenger airbag disconnection switch in case a rearward-facing CRS needs to be installed in the front passenger seat. All these aspects ensured a decent 4-star safety rating. At the time, it bagged the highest combined points for any vehicle in India. That is a testament to the fact that it was ahead of the competition since the beginning. Also Read: What is Maruti WagonR Safety Rating by Global NCAP? Utkarsh Joshi November 14, 2024 Share Facebook Twitter WhatsApp Linkedin ReddIt Email Print Telegram Advertisment Mahindra XUV 3XO has secured a 5-star safety rating from Bharat NCAP. The SUV was crash-tested by Bharat NCAP in October 2024. This safety rating applies to all variants of the SUV. The 3XO was launched in India in April 2024. Since then, the compact SUV has gained a lot of popularity in the country. The Mahindra Thar Roxx and XUV400 SUVs were also tested by BNCAP and awarded a 5-star rating. Read Also: Buyers face waiting periods of up to 3 months for Tata Curvv Table of Contents - Advertisement - Toggle Mahindra XUV 3XO: Bharat NCAP test results explained Conclusion Mahindra XUV 3XO: Bharat NCAP test results explained Mahindra XUV 3XO scored 29.36 points out of a possible 32 in the Adult Occupants Protection (AOP) test. In the frontal offset deformable test, the SUV offered good protection to the drivers and passengers head, neck, and abdomen. The drivers chest and right leg showed adequate protection while the left leg showed marginal protection. The passengers chest and legs were well protected. In the side movable deformable barrier test and side pole impact test, the SUV offered good protection to the head, chest, and abdomen. Mahindra XUV 3XO scored 43 points out of a possible 49 in the Child Occupant Protection (COP) test. It got a Dynamic score of 24 points (max. 24), a CRS installation score of 12 points (max. 12), and a Vehicle assessment score of 7 points (max. 13). The SUV was crash tested using test dummies for 18-month-old and 3-year-old children. Mahindra XUV 3XO is packed with 35 standard safety features. It features 6 airbags, 3-point seatbelts for all passengers, ISOFIX child seat anchorages, a 360-degree camera, a Blind View Monitor and more. The SUV is also equipped with a Level 2 ADAS package with features like Automatic Emergency Braking (AEB), Lane Departure Warning, and Lane Keep Assist. R Velusamy, President, Automotive Technology and Product Development, Mahindra & Mahindra Ltd. , said, At Mahindra, safety has always been at the core of our product development, and we have trailblazed our way to achieving the highest safety standards on Indian roads. The 5-star Bharat-NCAP ratings for the Thar ROXX, XUV 3XO, and XUV400 reaffirm our mission to create world-class SUVs that offer both outstanding performance and unmatched safety. From pioneering the introduction of six airbags in 2011 to now leading the charge with multiple 5-star-rated vehicles, we continue to set new benchmarks for safety across all segments. As Indias safety norms evolve, Mahindra will continue to push the envelope, ensuring highest safety standards for its SUVs. It rivals the likes of the Maruti Suzuki Brezza , Hyundai Venue facelift , Kia Sonet , Tata Nexon , Renault Kiger , Toyota Urban Cruiser Taisor , Maruti Suzuki Fronx , and Nissan Magnite . - protection scores are almost identical to the Tata Nexon. Published On Nov 14, 2024 11:10:00 AM 17,475 Views Follow us on By Akbar Merchant Share - Listen to this Article Your browser does not support the audio element. The Mahindra XUV 3XO compact SUV has scored a 5-star rating in both adult and child occupant protection in Bharat New Car Assessment Program's (BNCAP) safety tests. BNCAP tested the XUV 3XO's AX7 L and MX2 variants but the ratings are applicable on the entire line-up. Apart from the XUV 3XO, BNCAP has also released crash test ratings for the popular Thar Roxx SUV and the XUV400 EV . XUV 3XO gets 29.36 points for adult protection Secures 43 out of 49 points for child protection Thar Roxx, XUV400 BNCAP get high ratings too Mahindra XUV 3XO adult occupant protection The XUV 3XO scored 29.36 points out of 32 in adult occupant protection (AOP). The report noted that the protection offered to the drivers and the passengers head and neck region was good, although protection to the drivers chest was adequate, and left leg was marginal, likely due to impact with the centre console area. The XUV 3XO secured 13.36 out of 16.00 in the frontal offset deformable barrier test. In the side movable deformable barrier test, it secured 16.00 out of 16.00, offering good protection overall. In the side pole impact test, it was rated OK. The XUV 3XO also complied with ESC test requirements. Bharat NCAP, however, does not specify is the body shell was stable and capable of withstanding further loadings. Mahindra XUV 3XO child occupant protection In the child occupant protection, the XUV 3XO secured 43 out of 49 points. It got full points in the dynamic test (24/24) and CRS installation test (12/12) and scored 7 out of 13 in the vehicle assessment test. Both the 18-month-old and the 3-year-old child dummies were tested in rearward-facing child seats positioned in the front passenger seat, secured by ISOFIX anchorages and a support leg. Mahindra XUV 3XO safety features As standard, the XUV 3XO comes equipped with six airbags, three-point seatbelts with reminders for all passengers, Electronic Stability Control (ESC), ISOFIX anchors for rear outboard seats and a passenger-side airbag cut-off switch. The XUV 3XO also complies with AIS-100 pedestrian protection norms. Its top-spec variants even have an ADAS suite. Its direct rival, the Tata Nexon ,was tested by BNCAP last month, and it scored 29.41 out of 32 in AOP and 43.83 out of a maximum possible 49 points for COP. Meanwhile, the XUV 3XO's predecessor, the XUV 300 , had not only secured five stars but it had also registered the highest AOP and COP scores for any made-in-India vehicle tested by Global NCAP back in January 2020. (M&M Ltd.), one of Indias leading automotive companies, today announced that its overall auto sales for the month of October 2024 stood at 96648 vehicles, including exports. Mahindra records highest-ever sales of 54,504 units in October 2024 Homegrown SUV maker is seeing rising demand thanks to popular models like the Thar Roxx and XUV 3XO, among others. Published On Nov 04, 2024 12:07:00 PM 10,015 Views Follow us on Recently launched Thar Roxx among Mahindra's popular models. By Akbar Merchant Share - Listen to this Article Your browser does not support the audio element. Mahindra recorded its highest-ever monthly SUV sales of 54,504 units in October, up from 51,062 units in the previous month. The companys year-to-date performance remains strong, with total SUV sales reaching 3,14,714 units, representing a 22 percent growth compared to the previous twelve months. Mahindra exported 3,506 units in October XUV 3XO sales average 9,000-10,000 units a month Mahindra's performance was highlighted by strong demand across its SUV portfolio during the festive season. Some of its models, such as the Thar Roxx, have been doing exceptionally well. The demand for the Roxx crossed 1.76 lakh units within an hour of its bookings opening. Deliveries for the Thar Roxx have commenced in phases, and some buyers have a delivery timeline as late as May 2026 . In addition to the domestic SUV sales, Mahindras export figures stood at 3,506 units, marking an 89 percent increase compared to the previous year. Another popular model from Mahindra, the XUV 3XO, saw average monthly sales in the range of 9,000-10,000 units. The waiting period for the Kia Sonet and Hyundai Venue rival is as high as six months for some variants. Mahindra records highest-ever sales of 54,504 units in October 2024 Homegrown SUV maker is seeing rising demand thanks to popular models like the Thar Roxx and XUV 3XO, among others. Published On Nov 04, 2024 12:07:00 PM 10,015 Views Follow us on Recently launched Thar Roxx among Mahindra's popular models. By Akbar Merchant Share - Listen to this Article Your browser does not support the audio element. Mahindra recorded its highest-ever monthly SUV sales of 54,504 units in October, up from 51,062 units in the previous month. The companys year-to-date performance remains strong, with total SUV sales reaching 3,14,714 units, representing a 22 percent growth compared to the previous twelve months. Mahindra exported 3,506 units in October XUV 3XO sales average 9,000-10,000 units a month Mahindra's performance was highlighted by strong demand across its SUV portfolio during the festive season. Some of its models, such as the Thar Roxx, have been doing exceptionally well. The demand for the Roxx crossed 1.76 lakh units within an hour of its bookings opening. Deliveries for the Thar Roxx have commenced in phases, and some buyers have a delivery timeline as late as May 2026 . In addition to the domestic SUV sales, Mahindras export figures stood at 3,506 units, marking an 89 percent increase compared to the previous year. Another popular model from Mahindra, the XUV 3XO, saw average monthly sales in the range of 9,000-10,000 units. The waiting period for the Kia Sonet and Hyundai Venue rival is as high as six months for some variants. ☰ Mahindra XUV 3XO Report

Executive Summary

The SUV market has shown robust growth in recent years, driven by increasing consumer preference for versatility, safety, and comfort. The Mahindra XUV 3XO is a significant player in the sub-compact SUV segment, offering a compelling combination of features, performance, and safety. Recent sales data indicates strong demand for the XUV 3XO, supported by its competitive pricing and positive reviews.

This section provides a high-level overview of the SUV market and the Mahindra XUV 3XO's position within it. Key insights and strategic implications are highlighted to provide a concise summary.

  • SUV market continues to expand with electric and hybrid models.
  • Mahindra XUV 3XO offers a fresh look to the segment.
  • XUV 3XO sales are robust, driven by competitive pricing.
  • Mahindra focuses on integrating advanced technology into SUVs.

Market Analysis

The SUV market is segmented by type (Compact SUVs, Mid-Size SUVs, Full-Size SUVs, Luxury SUVs, Electric SUVs, Hybrid SUVs), by fuel type (Gasoline SUVs, Diesel SUVs, Electric SUVs, Hybrid SUVs), by drivetrain, by seating capacity, and by application (Personal Use SUVs, Commercial Use SUVs, Off-Road SUVs). The global SUV market was valued at USD 1.36 Trillion in 2024 and is projected to reach a value of USD 2.2 Trillion by 2032, expanding at a compound annual growth rate (CAGR) of 6% during the forecast period.

This section analyzes the overall SUV market dynamics, including size, growth, segmentation, and key trends.

  • Global SUV market valued at USD 1.36 Trillion in 2024.
  • Projected to reach USD 2.2 Trillion by 2032.
  • Expanding at a CAGR of 6% during the forecast period.
  • Market driven by urbanization and rising disposable income.

Features

The Mahindra XUV 3XO has 1 Diesel Engine and 1 Petrol Engine on offer. The Diesel engine is 1498 cc while the Petrol engine is 1197 cc . It is available with Manual & Automatic transmission.Depending upon the variant and fuel type the XUV 3XO has a mileage of 17.96 to 20.6 kmpl. The XUV 3XO is a 5 seater 3 cylinder car and has length of 3990 mm, width of 1821 mm and a wheelbase of 2600.

  • Soft touch material on dashboard and door pads.
  • Panoramic sunroof - largest in the segment.
  • Level 2 ADAS with features such as forward collision warning, adaptive cruise control.
  • 1.2-litre turbo-petrol engine makes 130PS/230Nm most powerful in its class.

Safety

The Mahindra XUV 3XO has secured a 5-star safety rating from Bharat NCAP. The SUV was crash-tested by Bharat NCAP in October 2024. The XUV 3XO scored 29.36 points out of 32 in adult occupant protection and 43 points out of 49 in child occupant protection.

  • 5-star rating for adult occupant protection.
  • Child occupant protection receives 5-star rating.

Executive Summary Market Analysis Features Safety Sales Data

Executive Summary

The SUV market has shown robust growth in recent years, driven by increasing consumer preference for versatility, safety, and comfort. The Mahindra XUV 3XO is a significant player in the sub-compact SUV segment, offering a compelling combination of features, performance, and safety. Recent sales data indicates strong demand for the XUV 3XO, supported by its competitive pricing and positive reviews.

This section provides a high-level overview of the SUV market and the Mahindra XUV 3XO's position within it. Key insights and strategic implications are highlighted to provide a concise summary.

  • SUV market continues to expand with electric and hybrid models.
  • Mahindra XUV 3XO offers a fresh look to the segment.
  • XUV 3XO sales are robust, driven by competitive pricing.
  • Mahindra focuses on integrating advanced technology into SUVs.
Month Sales No.
Jan 20258,454
Feb 20257,861
Mar 20257,055
Apr 20257,568
May 20257,952
Jun 20257,089
Mahindra XUV 3XO Soft touch material on dashboard and door pads.

Market Analysis

The SUV market is segmented by type (Compact SUVs, Mid-Size SUVs, Full-Size SUVs, Luxury SUVs, Electric SUVs, Hybrid SUVs), by fuel type (Gasoline SUVs, Diesel SUVs, Electric SUVs, Hybrid SUVs), by drivetrain, by seating capacity, and by application (Personal Use SUVs, Commercial Use SUVs, Off-Road SUVs). The global SUV market was valued at USD 1.36 Trillion in 2024 and is projected to reach a value of USD 2.2 Trillion by 2032, expanding at a compound annual growth rate (CAGR) of 6% during the forecast period.

This section analyzes the overall SUV market dynamics, including size, growth, segmentation, and key trends.

  • Global SUV market valued at USD 1.36 Trillion in 2024.
  • Projected to reach USD 2.2 Trillion by 2032.
  • Expanding at a CAGR of 6% during the forecast period.
  • Market driven by urbanization and rising disposable income.

Features

The Mahindra XUV 3XO has 1 Diesel Engine and 1 Petrol Engine on offer. The Diesel engine is 1498 cc while the Petrol engine is 1197 cc . It is available with Manual & Automatic transmission.Depending upon the variant and fuel type the XUV 3XO has a mileage of 17.96 to 20.6 kmpl. The XUV 3XO is a 5 seater 3 cylinder car and has length of 3990 mm, width of 1821 mm and a wheelbase of 2600.

  • Soft touch material on dashboard and door pads.
  • Panoramic sunroof - largest in the segment.
  • Level 2 ADAS with features such as forward collision warning, adaptive cruise control.
  • 1.2-litre turbo-petrol engine makes 130PS/230Nm most powerful in its class.

Safety

The Mahindra XUV 3XO has secured a 5-star safety rating from Bharat NCAP. The SUV was crash-tested by Bharat NCAP in October 2024. The XUV 3XO scored 29.36 points out of 32 in adult occupant protection and 43 points out of 49 in child occupant protection.

  • 5-star rating for adult occupant protection.
  • Child occupant protection receives 5-star rating.
  • Standard safety features include 6 airbags, ESC, reverse parking sensors, & more.
  • Level 2 ADAS available.

Sales Data

In June 2025, the total sales figure of XUV 3XO was 7,089 units, which is a 10.85 percent MoM decline. In December 2024, XUV3XO witnessed a staggering growth of 97.18%, with sales of 7,000 units in December 2024 compared to 3,550 units in December 2023.

  • XUV 3XO sales: 7,089 units in June 2025.
  • December 2024 sales up 97.18% YoY.
  • High demand for the model.
  • Sales impacted by market conditions.
